TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit GenericPrincipal extends System.Security.Claims.ClaimsPrincipal

remarks.format:
## Remarks This class represents the roles of the current user.
## Examples The following example shows the use of members of the GenericPrincipal class.
[!CODE [System.Security.Principal.GenericPrincipal2#1](../CodeSnippet/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Principal.GenericPrincipal2#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Security.Principal.IIdentity identity, string[] roles) cil managed

Docs.param: A basic implementation of <see cref="T:System.Security.Principal.IIdentity"> that represents any user.
An array of role names to which the user represented by the parameter belongs.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Security.Principal.GenericPrincipal"> class from a user identity and an array of role names to which the user represented by that identity belongs.

Docs.summary: Gets the <see cref="T:System.Security.Principal.GenericIdentity"> of the user represented by the current <xref:System.Security.Principal.GenericPrincipal>.
Docs.value: The <see cref="T:System.Security.Principal.GenericIdentity"> of the user represented by the <xref:System.Security.Principal.GenericPrincipal>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool IsInRole(string role) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the role for which to check membership.
Docs.summary: Determines whether the current <see cref="T:System.Security.Principal.GenericPrincipal"> belongs to the specified role.
Docs.returns: `true` if the current <see cref="T:System.Security.Principal.GenericPrincipal"> is a member of the specified role; otherwise, `false`.
